medical_history.chief_complaint: Acute midepigastric/right upper quadrant abdominal pain associated with diaphoresis.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms developed acutely 1 day prior to admission, characterized by midepigastric and right upper quadrant abdominal pain. The patient denied nausea, vomiting, fever, chills, and reported baseline functional status with daily exercises.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Morbid obesity status post-laparoscopic Roux-en-Y gastric bypass, hypertension, asthma (no recent flares), gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD), cellulitis of abdominal pannus, and various surgical history including D&Cs for bleeding, tonsillectomy, and hysterectomy.
medical_history.family_history: Noteworthy for heart disease, hypertension, asthma, and amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS).
